group_1.textRight: ...Alright, then.@When the documents are ready...
...I'll get back in touch with you.

group_1.textLeft: Give my regards to the lawyer.

group_1.textRight: ...What was that just now?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, that was someone from the attorney's office...
...here to help with my inheritance!

group_1.textRight: Inheritance?

group_1.textLeft: The truth is, I came upon an unexpected windfall...
I found a pot of gold under the floor of the@Tomorrow Shop!

group_1.textRight: Ah, that, huh?
...I mean, ehhh?!

group_1.textLeft: Oh, did you already hear about it?

group_1.textRight: No no no, of course not!
(...I didn't hear about it, but I DID know it was there!)
What in the world actually happened?

group_1.textLeft: It's just like I said.
The cement around the board underneath the@gaming machine was coming loose.

group_1.textRight: (...That's because I pulled at it the other day...)

group_1.textLeft: I was a little worried about it, so I tried pulling up@the board...
And I found the pot of gold coins that my husband@had stashed away in there!

group_1.textRight: [chara:305101:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!
Your...husband?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, it was the gold coins he'd been collecting@little by little since his youth.
To my surprise, they've appreciated in value@by now!
Of course, there are various procedures required@in order to manage it...
...like converting it to cash, and paying taxes on it.
It's far from 20 million yen, but it should make up@the difference enough...
...to make the Tomorrow Shop mine!

group_1.textRight: I can't believe it wasn't criminal funds, and it was@just regular old personal savings...!
How do you know for sure this is your husband's savings?

group_1.textLeft: There were receipts and statements documenting it.
He left it all to me in his will.

group_1.textRight: Then, it's a good thing no one besides you came and found it...

group_1.textLeft: Well, he left it to me in writing.
He wrote that there was a secret stash hidden@away somewhere.
But for some reason, there was no map showing@the location...
...so I had pretty much given up...

group_1.textRight: [chara:305101:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!
Could that "map" possibly be...@This?!

group_1.textLeft: Oh my, it certainly looks like my husband's@handwriting.

group_1.textRight: This map...@It has to be the map he forgot to include!

group_1.textLeft: Where ever did you find it?

group_1.textRight: It was stuck inside a book from the library...@A book by a folklorist named Satomi-something.

group_1.textLeft: Ahh...@My husband used to be a junior high school teacher.
He enjoyed books like that.  He would entertain@himself by looking into the origins of children's@nursery rhymes...
...like the one about Jizo, the Buddhist protector of children.

group_1.textRight: I can't believe what a coincidence this is...

group_1.textLeft: Heh.
Oh yeah, my husband's note also said:
"Keep the smiles going at the Tomorrow Shop."

group_1.textRight: Ah...
Is there some kind of rule...
...that you have to say a crazy amount of change@every time?

group_1.textLeft: Ah... Actually, yes, that is the case.
It was in the last will and testament of my late husband...
...to do that every time, when giving change.

group_1.textRight: So, that joke wasn't totally a lie, was it?

group_1.textLeft: Heheheh!
